Arduino Uno Code:
```
// Alternating blink
// This code interfaces with a circuit that has two LEDS that blink in an alternating pattern.
// The pattern changes every second.

// LED 1 on Digital I/O 5
#define PIN_LED1 5
// LED 2 on Digital I/O 6
#define PIN_LED2 6

// the setup function runs once when you press reset or power the board
void setup() {
    // Initialize LED pins to output mode
    pinMode(PIN_LED1, OUTPUT);
    pinMode(PIN_LED2, OUTPUT);
}

// the loop function runs over and over again forever
void loop() {
    digitalWrite(PIN_LED1, HIGH);     // Turn LED 1 ON
    digitalWrite(PIN_LED2, LOW);      // Turn LED 2 OFF
    delay(1000);                      // wait for a second
    digitalWrite(PIN_LED1, HIGH);     // Turn LED 1 OFF
    digitalWrite(PIN_LED2, LOW);      // Turn LED 2 ON
    delay(1000);                      // wait for a second
}
```

Instructions:
```
- This code uses only standard libraries. No additional libraries are required in the library manager.
- Assemble circuit and program as normal. 
```

// Alternating blink
// This code interfaces with a circuit that has two LEDS that blink in an alternating pattern.
// The pattern changes every second.

// LED 1 on Digital I/O 5
#define PIN_LED1 5
// LED 2 on Digital I/O 6
#define PIN_LED2 6

// the setup function runs once when you press reset or power the board
void setup() {
    // Initialize LED pins to output mode
    pinMode(PIN_LED1, OUTPUT);
    pinMode(PIN_LED2, OUTPUT);
}

// the loop function runs over and over again forever
void loop() {
    digitalWrite(PIN_LED1, HIGH);     // Turn LED 1 ON
    digitalWrite(PIN_LED2, LOW);      // Turn LED 2 OFF
    delay(1000);                      // wait for a second
    digitalWrite(PIN_LED1, HIGH);     // Turn LED 1 OFF
    digitalWrite(PIN_LED2, LOW);      // Turn LED 2 ON
    delay(1000);                      // wait for a second
}
```

```

    {"part":"Arduino Uno", "name":"uno", "value":"", "notes":"Arduino Uno microcontroller"},
    {"part":"QST QMC5883L Magnetometer", "name":"mag", "value":"", "notes":"QST QMC5883L 3-axis magnetometer"},
    {"part":"Neopixel Ring", "name":"ring", "value":"16 pixels", "notes":"16-pixel WS2812B Neopixel Ring"},
    {"part":"Resistor", "name":"R1", "value":"10k ohm", "notes":"Pull-up resistor for I2C SDA line"},
    {"part":"Resistor", "name":"R2", "value":"10k ohm", "notes":"Pull-up resistor for I2C SCL line"}
]
```

Pinouts:
```
{
    "Arduino Uno": ["5V", "3.3V", "GND", "AREF", "D0/RX", "D1/TX", "D2", "D3", "D4", "D5", "D6", "D7", "D8", "D9", "D10", "D11", "D12", "D13", "A0", "A1", "A2", "A3", "A4/SDA", "A5/SCL"],
    "QMC5883L Magnetometer": ["VCC", "GND", "SDA", "SCL"],
    "Neopixel Ring": ["VCC", "GND", "DIN"],
    "R1": ["1", "2"],
    "R2": ["1", "2"]
}
```

```
[
    [{"name":"mag", "pin":"VCC"}, {"name": "uno", "pin":"3.3V"}], # Connect Magnetometer VCC to Uno 3.3V
    [{"name":"mag", "pin":"GND"}, {"name": "uno", "pin":"GND"}], # Connect Magnetometer GND to Uno GND
    [{"name":"mag", "pin":"SDA"}, {"name": "uno", "pin":"A4/SDA"}], # Connect Magnetometer SDA to Uno A4/SDA
    [{"name":"mag", "pin":"SCL"}, {"name": "uno", "pin":"A5/SCL"}], # Connect Magnetometer SCL to Uno A5/SCL
    [{"name":"R1", "pin":"1"}, {"name": "uno", "pin":"3.3V"}], # Connect R1 pin 1 to Uno 3.3V
    [{"name":"R1", "pin":"2"}, {"name": "uno", "pin":"A4/SDA"}], # Connect R1 pin 2 to Uno A4/SDA (pull-up)
    [{"name":"R2", "pin":"1"}, {"name": "uno", "pin":"3.3V"}], # Connect R2 pin 1 to Uno 3.3V
    [{"name":"R2", "pin":"2"}, {"name": "uno", "pin":"A5/SCL"}], # Connect R2 pin 2 to Uno A5/SCL (pull-up)
    [{"name":"ring", "pin":"VCC"}, {"name": "uno", "pin":"5V"}], # Connect Neopixel Ring VCC to Uno 5V
    [{"name":"ring", "pin":"GND"}, {"name": "uno", "pin":"GND"}], # Connect Neopixel Ring GND to Uno GND
    [{"name":"ring", "pin":"DIN"}, {"name": "uno", "pin":"D6"}] # Connect Neopixel Ring DIN to Uno D6
]
```

Arduino Uno Code:
```
#include <Wire.h>
#include <Adafruit_Sensor.h>
#include <Adafruit_QMC5883.h>
#include <Adafruit_NeoPixel.h>

// Magnetometer
Adafruit_QMC5883 mag = Adafruit_QMC5883();

// Neopixel Ring
#define PIN_RING 6
#define NUM_PIXELS 16
Adafruit_NeoPixel ring(NUM_PIXELS, PIN_RING, NEO_GRB + NEO_KHZ800);

// Function to map heading to Neopixel index
int headingToIndex(float heading) {
  return int((heading / 360.0) * NUM_PIXELS) % NUM_PIXELS;
}

void setup() {
  // Initialize Magnetometer
  if (!mag.begin()) {
    while (1); // Halt if magnetometer not found
  }

  // Initialize Neopixel Ring
  ring.begin();
  ring.show(); // Initialize all pixels to 'off'
}

void loop() {
  // Read magnetometer data
  sensors_event_t event;
  mag.getEvent(&event);

  // Calculate heading
  float heading = atan2(event.magnetic.y, event.magnetic.x) * 180 / PI;
  if (heading < 0) heading += 360;

  // Clear Neopixel Ring
  ring.clear();

  // Set North pixel to green
  int northIndex = headingToIndex(0);
  ring.setPixelColor(northIndex, ring.Color(0, 255, 0));

  // Set current heading pixel to blue
  int headingIndex = headingToIndex(heading);
  ring.setPixelColor(headingIndex, ring.Color(0, 0, 255));

  // Update Neopixel Ring
  ring.show();

  // Wait for a short period before the next reading
  delay(100);
}
```

Instructions:
```
- Install the following libraries in the Arduino IDE Library Manager:
  - Adafruit QMC5883L
  - Adafruit NeoPixel
- Assemble the circuit and program as normal.
```
